Reviews.Title: “Filthy Suite”
Reviews.Author: KeyWesterDave
Reviews.Content: Complete opposite of what I typically find at a Marriott Suites property. Contacted the property, but no response.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Idowhatmywifesays
Reviews.Content: A nice little hotel only a short stroll from the inner harbor. The desk staff is very helpful and took extra time to explain all the neighborhoods and sites to see. Other reviews spoke of location and people hanging out in the street, it is a city and like any other city you don't walk around with money taped to your forehead....so it doesn't matter where you stay on that end. If you want a hotel in good location, in cool old bank and want to save a couple of dollars....then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Management!!!”
Reviews.Author: CSSTL
Reviews.Content: Check in process was painful with Debra, Assistant General Manager. Had to request sheet change upon room check-in. Horrendous odor throughout the lobby area during our stay. One of the elevators was out of service during our stay which delayed service. I would go into detail, but I have written Palmetto Hospitality with full disclosure of our experience. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL.....REGARDLESS OF LOCATION!!! There are awesome hotels surrounding this area!

Reviews.Title: “More than a little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: hli10140419
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairfield inn & Suits for one night. I redeemed rewards points for which I would like to be reimbursed. The service and the rooms are absolutely horrendous. I will never stay here again. The hotel is a converted bank. The lobby is very interesting as it has the original marble from its days as a bank. That's where the ambiance ends. I should have known there issues. The hotel manager asked a guest if the hotel were the best Fairfield in ever, the guest replied "That remains to be seen". Well it isn't. The property is non-smoking however, I was given a room that the previous guest obviously smoked in. I was moved to another room. I asked for extra firm pillows. It took more an hour to receive them. A security guard showed up with 2 pillows without pillow cases. When I asked about them he told me he wasn't told to bring pillow cases. I asked him why he would bring pillows with no cases? He finally said, this wasn't his job, he just asked to bring the pillows. I called the front desk, who apologized. An hour later a police officer came to my door with the pillow cases. Imagine my surprise. After all of this it turned out the bed was uncomfortable! The next morning when I mentioned it to the staff, I was told that the police officer was assisting because there were no housekeeping staff on duty. I will never return to this property nor can I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: krsomega
Reviews.Content: We have traveled ALOT and have never encountered such a genuine staff at a hotel...from the front desk folks (shout out to Edwin & Jeffery) to the valets & hotel managers, all we so nice. We parked our car & the front desk arranged for a complimentary restaurant shuttle to pick us up and return us back to the hotel after dinner. Both places that were recommended fit our needs perfectly. Our room was on an end so it was very large, comfortable bed & clean room. We experienced no "old" smell as someone else had mentioned. The complimentary breakfast also included hot waffles, cereal, yogurt, pastries etc. We are already booked to return to this hotel 3 more times this year!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms fine, service fine, location excellent for harbor-area and downtown activities”
Reviews.Author: Gerbuddy
Reviews.Content: Hotel is std. SHS design, form and function. Our stay was fine and the location is why you come here. At the corner of Pratt and Commerce St., there is an outdoor parking lot that is 25% cheaper than hotel and can fit my van (>6'6" tall).

Reviews.Title: “Greatly located....view of an abandoned building”
Reviews.Author: KCKWashDC
Reviews.Content: Just arrived and everyone was friendly. The room smelled old, like no one's been in it awhile. We went to the window to check out the view. We have a view of an abandoned building. Oh well, we fixed that by closing the drapes. So far so good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the heart of the inner harbor”
Reviews.Author: freqroamer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during November. The room was spacious and I liked the modern styling.

Reviews.Title: “Not your average urban chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelswithlabs
Reviews.Content: The outstanding features of this hotel are the "all suites" guest rooms, affordable prices and lovely historic details preserved in this old bank building. Also worth mentioning is the location, just two blocks up from Baltimore's Inner Harbor. I spent 5 nights there last week, while attending a conference at the Convention Center. Most of the 4000 attendees were staying at the hotels closest to the convention center, and paying over $200 per night for a smaller, average hotel room. I was sharing a suite, with two beds and separate living space for $161 per night! The living space includes a sink area with coffee maker, fridge and microwave, easy chair, small couch and desk space. In the bathroom area, the sink is separate, which is always convenient when two people are getting ready to go out at the same time. The beds are comfortable, but are not the really plush, deep-mattress beds that you see in luxury hotels, and the bedding is the kind I like for cleanliness, with sheets covering a comforter. The free breakfast was very good, with sufficient toasters for guests to easily get a turn at toasting bagels, English muffins or bread. There were a variety of choices for breakfast, hot and cold. The old bank details included letter boxes, beautiful art deco doors on the elevators and an old vault on the lower level, now used as meeting space. Since I flew into Baltimore, I did not have to worry about parking, so I cannot comment on that at all. The one issue that I found unpleasant, was the nightly 1:00 a.m. "wake-up call" from rowdy crowds in the streets. Other reviews have mentioned this, when the nightclubs close. Although I asked for a quiet room, and was given a 7th floor room, the noise level made it impossible to sleep through the commotion. Although I am not sure, I think that the "Occupy Baltimore" group also staged a very noisy protest in the middle of the night, one night. I would recommend this hotel and would certainly stay her again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: DuchessofHildebran
Reviews.Content: I travel to Baltimore about 5-6 times throughout the fall season due to lacrosse tournaments and ALWAYS choose this hotel due to its central location and beautiful amenities. However, my stay on Friday, December 2 was the worst stay I have ever had at ANY hotel. It was about midnight and I must have been in between 2 rooms that decided to have a party. The guests (not sure if I can even call them that) we throwing around the WORST obscenities (use your imagination) and racial slurs; not to mention pounding on doors, running through the hallways and breaking items. I had to call the front desk 3 times from midnight to 3:30 am and they had the audacity at ask me to change rooms! I was not the problem! I would have expected this behavior and the management's reaction from a lower hotel chain NOT a Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel! Great location, free hot breakfast, wonderful room!”
Reviews.Author: IheartMD
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located only 2 blocks from the Inner Harbor so it's very easy to walk everywhere. We even walked to Powerplant in heels which wasn't bad at as all. You are also near the Harborplace Mall. There is a parking garage one street up from the hotel for $20 instead of paying $32 for valet. The rooms are great. We got the one king bed and sofabed so the room, if you wanted, could really sleep 5. Free hot breakfast consisted of oatmeal, waffles, cereal, scrambled eggs, sausage, bagels, english muffins, asst juices, and coffee. Get there before 9:30 to get the waffles. Nothing bad about this hotel, we will def stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby”
Reviews.Author: thunderfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a Friday night in using a free night certificate from Marriott….so the price was just right! And we just used the $32 valet parking since we were only here for a night. The lobby is beautiful in how they kept the detail from the bank that was an obvious previous tenant of the space. All of the hotel personnel we encountered were friendly and helpful. Our one king bed suite was very nice. I tried using the wireless in the room but it locked up, so I just used the hardwire connection instead. Having read previous reviews warning about the noise from the nightclub I asked for an upper level floor on the opposite side of the hotel away from the club, so that worked out nicely with us being placed on the 7th floor. We stayed in conjunction with a concert at the Hippodrome Theater, which was only about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. We also walked about 20 minutes to the Federal Hill neighborhood for dinner using Light Street into the Inner Harbor. With this being downtown Baltimore, one must use common sense in choosing where to walk in the city but we felt safe walking along Baltimore Street to the theater and near the Inner Harbor. If we get another chance to have an overnight stay in the Inner Harbor area we will definitely consider staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “2 blocks from the Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: akuwa
Reviews.Content: Great location and large suites, the early eighties furniture didn't matter because it was clean and spacious. One downfall is valet parking is too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Fred B
Reviews.Content: 1) I was awakened at 1.45am as the people in the nearby niteclub spilled into the streets 2) I sent a nice, new shirt out to be cleaned and it was not returned. Both the hotel manager and the laundry service denied responsibility. The best the manager would offer me is taking the laundry charge off the bill -- for the shirt I did not get back! A rather unpleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms-close the everything!”
Reviews.Author: Prinsassjo
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and spacious. The employees are nice, helpful and efficient. The breakfast was ok, for free. It's a converted bank so the rooms are not what you normally get with a suite, there is no way to close off the living area from the sleeping area. The old vault in the basement is neat to see. The wifi connection was bad.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel if you can tolerate the noise”
Reviews.Author: Tripaholic1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and comfortable. The only problem was that between 1:00- 2:00 AM, it was ridiculously loud as everyone was coming out of the clubs. Its a good location being a few waslking blocks from the harbor but with that, it can get very loud at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown/Inner Harbor Location”
Reviews.Author: pgrabar
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I stayed here 3 nights for the Baltimore Grand Prix. The building is an old bank converted into a first rate hotel. The location was perfect - a couple blocks to the Inner Harbor and race track (the streets of Baltimore), restaurants, the Block, whatever suited your fancy. The hotel was clean and inviting, the personal was helpful and friendly across the board, from the valet parking attendants to the front desk staff. The free breakfast, including hot eggs, sausage, bacon, etc. was good. Our room had 2 queen beds plus a sleeper sofa, a nice bathroom, and enough room to walk around - much better than a standard non-suite room. Bottom line - I'd stay here again the next time I want to stay downtown in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Baltimore Gp Weekend>>>> Return HOME NIGHTMARE”
Reviews.Author: Gregconnor_11
Reviews.Content: Incompetence in the way my money has been taken from my account by the billing department has meant I have returned to UK with a cleaned out bank account!!! ~This would have been a 4 star rating if it had not been for the fact that due to some idiot member of staff taking £189 then £210.19 then £222.55 THEN the full hotel amount of £513.39 then they tried to take a further £321.00 !!! This has totally messed up my family finances and ruined what would have been a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great gateway to Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: terere2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hidden chain gem. We were able to check in early after an overnight flight and light rail ride into town. Service was excellent and friendly. The lobby is delightful for breakfast or hanging out. This is converted bank so the lobby has high ceilings and is very spacious. Down a spiral staircase is the small fitness room (A/C problems during our stay) and a cool meeting room inside the old vault - the door is still intact. It's a short walk to the Inner Harbor and the purple line Charm Circulator (free bus) stops nearby. I'm a Platinum SPG member and usually stay at Starwood properties but I'm glad that we tried this Marriott. We'll be back! This is not an upscale experience but very solid hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loulabelle44
Reviews.Content: The SpringHill Suites is a lovely hotel. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. The lobby was very large, with coffee always available. Check-in was quick and efficient. The room was large, with a seperate sofa area and desk. The beds were very comfortable, and the room had a second TV over the beds, with a good selection of digital channels. There was not much of a view, though, although I could see the Ravens stadium in the distance. The hotel is situated only a few blocks from the Inner Harbor. As with anywhere in Baltimore, there were a few people hanging around on the streets a couple of blocks away, but it's fine as long as you are sensible. The breakfast buffet was very good. There was a lot to choose from. Cereal, oatmeal, fruit salad, bagels, hot items, waffle iron, bread. This is a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A weekend in Baltimores inner harbor area”
Reviews.Author: Terpsfan72
Reviews.Content: Stayed the weekend at Springhill suites with a friend who came down from New York City. After picking her up from Penn Station we pulled up outfront of hotel, valet parking was very expensive, $32 for every night. Quick and easy check-in. Room was a bit pricey, $134 a night and that was with my AAA discount, but I think thats pricey because I'm used to staying at very nice hotels in Vegas for at most half the price many times, but oh well. Room was ok size, I'd say maybe a little less than 350sq feet. Nice sized bathroom, sitting area, bed was comfortable. Some nice choices for eating right near hotel and innerharbor is not very far at all, about 3-4 blocks away. One gripe I had was you could hear way to much noise from hallways, wondering if you could hear as much from the rooms in the hallways. Overall a decent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Felt welcomed and good customer service.”
Reviews.Author: keeptraveling01
Reviews.Content: This hotel has recently added some upgrades to the suites and it shows. Flat screen TVs are in both the "living room" and the bedroom. There is a min fridge and microwave in the rooms. Recently added, in the last month are iPod docking stations. This was much appreciated after a long day of driving and listening to my iPod. I was able to charge it overnight and not have to search for my charger immediately. Mattresses could use an upgrade though. Not the best. Some fun restaurants are in walking distance along with places for shopping and if you don't want to walk to catch a baseball game there are other available means to get you there. Beware of the $32.00 a day for parking. While this does entitle one to leave as often during the day as needed, it is a little inconvienent and the added expense of tipping the Valet. Customer service was great. I called once there to get exact directions and they were very helpful and then I checked out a day earlier and no charges were applied for the day I cancelled. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good rates”
Reviews.Author: JennSVC21
Reviews.Content: Great location to inner harbor - friendly staff especially bell hop Jared. Hampton inn across street allows Springhill guests to use pool. Nice perk. Worn furniture in room. Great Internet and breakfast. Noisy at night on 3rd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice size rooms, friendly staff, but housekeeping was less than par”
Reviews.Author: KAW1970
Reviews.Content: Went to this hotel after reading several of the reviews. Upon our arrival we were greeted by valet, whom told us the outrageous rate. We decided to park there anyway, as to find a cheaper location was not worth it. When we got to our room we found it to be VERY large and roomy for 2 children and 2 adults. It was cleaned and well decorated. The price was a steal for what we received. We usually pay between $300-450 a night for a hotel and we did not get such a BIG suite like this! The hotel is literally 2 blocks from the Inner Harbor. We did not need our car for the entire stay! Now, for the disappointment; after returning from the Inner Harbor, we came back to our room to see the garbage not emptied, the bed not properly made (they just threw the comforter over the wrinkled disheveled sheets!) the air was turned down to 60 degrees; I guess she wanted to make sure she was comfortable doing a half job, because we were FREEZING! There were four people staying in this suite and she only left two towels and no washcloths or hand towels. When we arrived initally we only had three towels and had to ask the front desk for more. The breakfast was not worth getting up early for (served between 6-9am). the waffles was the only thing good, everything else needs a little work. The last night there we ask the front desk for information. She was busy on a personal call and gave us false information as a way to shoo us away. I expressed my concerns to the front desk and she offered a discount on one nights stay to compensate for the inconvenience. However, I still wanted to talk to manager who was not available until the next day. I did call Jason, hotel manager and left a voicemail and he PROMPTLY returned my call. He apologized and asked if there was anything he could do. I told him no we already received an adjustment for our stay, but thought it was very important that he knew about housekeeping, because it could make or break a hotel LITERALLY! He agreed and stated he was having a meeting with them at 11:30am that morning. One thing I notice about this manager is he takes the comments seriously and goes to lengths to try to correct the problem as I read from the many reviews. Overall, I would have easily gave this hotel 5 stars, but just couldn't based on the little mishaps! Nevertheless, do visit this hotel if you want space, and easy access to the Inner Harbor!

Reviews.Title: “It was all good!”
Reviews.Author: dpuryear
Reviews.Content: Our large suite was sparkling clean and had all the necessary amenities.. At the desk, Yolanda Holden guided us to local restaurants and gave us perfect directions to John Hopkins. Her patience and big smile helped make a tough trip tolerable. The historic building is remarkable in many ways and the rooms were extremely quiet. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Check....please?!?!”
Reviews.Author: Beantownsports
Reviews.Content: My family (wife, three small boys and myself) stayed at this hotel en route to Washington DC for a week. We checked in and went to the Red Sox/Oriole game. The following day we checked out to move on to DC. Once arriving in Washington, I asked my wife if she had our camera. After looking for it, we couldn't find it. She called the hotel and was told to leave a voice mail message for the person who handles lost and found. During the course of the week I made three additional calls to the hotel and spoke to a different person each time. None of the calls were returned, even if only to say the camera was not found. While I know the camera was not left at Camden Yards (because I remember seeing the camera the morning after the game in the hotel room),my wife asked me to call the Orioles' offices just in case. I called and left a message, and I received a call within ten minutes. I know it was my responsibility that the camera was lost., but it just would have been nice to have received a call back from the hotel indicating that the camera was not found or turned in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for anyone visiting the inner harbor!”
Reviews.Author: rcp27
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife and son on good Friday. The hotel is in a great location between inner harbor and Camden yards. The room was really nice. It included 2 flat screen tvs and a comfortable bed. The free breakfast was also a great addition to our stay. $32 for parking in an offsite lot was my only negative.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms, great service!”
Reviews.Author: cooldude11313
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the night after a college visit. This hotel was clean, well-maintained, well-staffed, and well-furnished. It's location is unparalleled to any other; it is about a five-minute walk to the shops (and excellent restaurants) on Baltimore's Inner Harbor. And, for those nightlife-seekers, it is about a block from a busy nightclub. With regards to this location, Springhill Suites is simply spectacular. The quality of their rooms was quite astounding. Our suite was divided into a bedroom area, a desk/sitting/kitchenette area, a vanity area, and a bathroom proper separated by a door. The sofa in the sitting area converted to a sofa bed (which, like most sofa beds, was somewhat uncomfortable). The sitting area and the bedroom area each had their own flat-screen televisions. Just off from the sitting area was a small kitchenette equipped with a sink, a microwave, a standard coffee set, and a mini-fridge. The room in general was thoroughly cleaned, and the bed (not the sofa-bed, mind you) was comfortable and made for great sleeping. Perhaps the only setback that we experienced was with the view from our room; the hotel is situated across the street from another hotel, and, on the lower floors at least, you can stare directly and wave into the window of another room across the screen (something I did frequently during my stay). The staff was personable and helpful; they always greeted us with a smile (even in the middle of the night) and a cheerful greet. During breakfasts (free; do-it-yourself waffle maker, eggs, biscuits & gravy, toast, coffee, juice, among others), the staff was always polite and ready to help out. On a final note, the hotel seems to be a remodeled early-twentieth-century bank. The lobby exudes the grandeur of a bygone era, and the basement (accessible via marble spiral staircase) holds the bank vault (which was converted into a meeting room). Also, in the elevator access room on the first floor, an antique mail chute attracts the eye of many a visitor. Overall, this hotel was exemplary, but the architecture, design, and history of the hotel truly bring all of the amazing parts together into a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hear anything outside”
Reviews.Author: andrwz28
Reviews.Content: the windows leak cool air in and windows are too thin because we can hear the bar and the people down in the street are saying. I was on the 5th floor!!

Reviews.Title: “An OK Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mashuganah
Reviews.Content: The staff are friendly and efficient and the rooms are clean. This is a basic hotel with basic amenities aside from the suite layout of the rooms, i.e., separate sitting area and bedroom areas. The hotel is in a converted bank where the vault was turned into a conference room with the original vault door intact (quite impressive). There are also beautiful marble staircases that remain. However, much of original beauty was covered with bland paint or hidden behind ugly walls (e.g., the ornate cast iron and marble staircase that runs the height of the building). It's a shame that so much charm and character were covered up with bland neutrality. The Good: The shower heads are high enough for for someone 6'2" to shower comfortably. Nice room layout. Nice staff. Clean. Within easy walking distance of the Inner Harbor - two blocks. The Not so Good: No room service. Thin doors - all hall conversation sounds like it's in your room. The free hot breakfast is all carbs except for the little containers of peanut butter. While they advertise eggs, none were available during my stay. Go elsewhere for a balanced breakfast. Tiny bar area - not a big deal as there are many nearby watering holes. If you like good coffee, ignore the in hotel "coffee." The in room coffee makers are designed to make single cups using specially packaged coffee and cannot be used to brew your own. However, there is a Starbucks and Caribou in walking distance. The desks in the rooms cannot be comfortably used for extended periods because the desk chairs are far too low and cannot be adjusted. Using a laptop on the desk keeps one's arms and wrists at a very uncomfortable angle. The Bad: Parking is $32/day. There are cheaper local garages but they have no re-entry privileges. Consequently, if you plan to use your car during your stay, the hotel parking is cheaper. There is no signage concerning parking. Pull up to the small hotel entrance and wait for a valet to appear. Valet parking is the only option.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, good value for stay”
Reviews.Author: bklynKat
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a visit to the SpringHill Suites. We stayed in a king studio suite on the 10th floor. The room was a nice size, with a small sitting area and a fridge/microwave. I was attending a convention at the Baltimore Convention Center, and it was an easy walk to the Convention Center (less than 10 minutes). The area is convenient, there's a 7-11 and CVS close by along with a huge variety of restaurants and shopping. I found the room to be quiet without much noise from the street, in spite of it being a busy business and tourist area. There are nice big flat screen TV's in the room and internet is included! The building is beautiful, particularly the lobby. The staff was wonderful including the front desk staff and the housekeeper who worked on our floor. The breakfast was good-- nice variety and it's really nice to have breakfast included, as well as complementary coffee brewing in the lobby throughout the day. There is a small business center located in the lobby where you can print a boarding pass or use the internet. The only disappointment I had was in the beds. They were definitely in good condition and seemed relatively new, but they were much more firm than I have come to expect from a Marriott. I noticed that the sheets often popped off the corners of the bed and that the mattress cover sort of slid around on the mattress when I changed positions. The sheets were comfortable and the pillows were plentiful which was great! There are lots of Marriott brand hotels in this area, I think the Springhill is a great value for business or leisure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location with great staff.”
Reviews.Author: topper65
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent guest of this hotel and enjoy the location and staff. The workout center isn't the greatest but it has most of the popular cardio machines.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and spacious hotel with lots of charm”
Reviews.Author: kristy29
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights while in Baltimore for a wedding. It was very centrally located, only a few blocks from the church and reception and the Inner Harbor. The room was huge! My husband and I shared a room with my parents and there was plenty of space for everyone. There was a sitting area with a desk, plus a kitchenette and a bedroom area. The sink was outside the shower and toilet, so that was helpful when everyone was getting ready. There was even a cute little nook thing that had nothing in it, but worked great as an extra changing space. The ceilings were so high it made the already large room seem huge. The closet was a little awkward, as the door was small but the closet was deep, so anything that went in the back was hard to get to. Also, the TV for the sitting area was hanging on a wall that faced another wall, and we all thought it had to swivel out, but it didn't so it was hard to see from the couches and the chair. It should either be moved or put on a swivel. The hotel was really cute, and we loved the old touches like the marble staircases and the old mail box. You could tell it was an old building, but it was restored very nicely. The valet guys were very nice, they helped my husband carry our luggage upstairs and they also gave us directions when we asked. Check in was quick. Breakfast was pretty good, but I've had better in other Springhill Suites. It was lacking hard boiled eggs and cottage cheese. There was pretty much no options for anyone not looking to load up on carbs. We walked to the Inner Harbor from the hotel and it was a quick couple of blocks. Definitely a must see while staying here. Overall a good stay in a quaint hotel. I would recommend this place and stay here again if I ever am in Baltimore again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Option in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: where2gonexttime
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the SpringHill Suites with my daughter for a college visit. The hotel lobby is lovely - I'm not sure what was there before the SH suites, but the windows, marble and other old architectural details are in keeping with an upscale hotel. The suite was very pretty, but a bit quirky layout. The seating area was comfortable and good sized with a nice tv, kitchenette and desk. But, the light switches were not connected with any of the lamps, and it took awhile to turn on the lights since many were not controlled by the wall switches. Our room had a bit of a smokey smell, but when we inquired at the front desk, they reassured us that the hotel was non-smoking. I'm not sure if the scent was from the cleaner, a bit musty, or the result of a previous guest that lit up despite the rules. While the front desk offered to change our room, we had unpacked and decided to live with the odor. The sleeping area was a very good size with very comfortable beds and linens. But the bathroom opened up to the bedroom and since there was no door to the vanity area, there was no privacy and very difficult to be quiet while others were sleeping. Maybe a pocket door would be a good solution. Otherwise - the bathroom fixtures and other appointments were very nice. Breakfast was ok - seems like the eggs could be upgraded to traditional scrambled eggs and that cut up fruit could be offered. Seating was adequate. Elevators were quick and we never had to wait. The location was great - a couple of blocks from the Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed expectations”
Reviews.Author: odie1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night while attending a function in Baltimore. My husband is a Gold Marriott Member and we actually had a free certificate for a category four or lower Marriott hotel. This hotel was chosen because it fit the category level and was closest to the function we attended. Check in was a breeze. Walking through the lobby we noticed the architecture of this hotel. It was originally a bank and still retains a lot of it's charm. We had a large corner suite on the fourth floor. There was a separate sitting room with couch, coffee table, desk and a small kitchenette (Microwave, sink, fridge, coffee maker). The bedroom was quite large as well. No view to speak of but that didn't bother us. The Bathroom was unremarkable but fine. Room was very clean (except for fingerprints all over the fridge). One elevator wasn't working while we were there which I think slowed things down a small amount. The bar was pretty small and basic open from 5-11. The breakfast served in the lobby area seemed to be well stocked. I would have liked to have seen real coffee cups instead or in addition to paper ones. There was a small "market" in the lobby where you could get some food items if needed. Valet was efficient-a little pricey to park at $32 per day but they did inform us there was a public car park around the corner and could park for free all day on Sunday on the street. One of them even ran down the block to hail us a cab. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel provided very comfortable accomodations and a fantastic staff.”
Reviews.Author: MPlietz
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived the hotel staff bent backwards to accomodate all my requests. The suite was lovely and very large. There is nothing I can complain about. Look forward to returning on Feb. 21st.

Reviews.Title: “Truly VIP treatment!!”
Reviews.Author: BTurner30
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for his birthday weekend. From the moment we stepped into the lobby, we were treated like VIPs! Although the entire staff was very helpful and friendly, we especially would like to thank Yolanda Holden! Upon learning that we were in town to celebrate my husband's birthday, she immediately sprang into action and made special arrangements to have a bottle of champagne delivered to our room! My husband also received a handwritten note wishing him a "happy birthday" from the Director of Sales (Kathleen Dombrowski) and Staff. It may seem small to some, but to us it was totally unexpected and much appreciated! Our room was large and clean. The king bed was super comfy. The free hot breakfast needs a little help though! The entire staff seemed to take us under their wing, and were super helpful and informative when it came to making recommendations for things to do, how to get there, and recommending the best places to get the kind of food we wanted to eat! We will definitely be staying there again!!

Reviews.Title: “HOSPITALITY!”
Reviews.Author: jaynay08
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beyond great! It met all our needs and had all the essential ammenities! The staff was so much like family and we felt very welcome and comfortable. The shuttle service was really efficient as well as they practically took you where you needed to go and not just to the BWI airport. I would recommend this hotel to everybody you will absolutely love it! I had three kids with me and the indoor pool was a plus as well as the complimentary breakfast...

Reviews.Title: “I Really Like This Hotel and New Brand”
Reviews.Author: TransCon1
Reviews.Content: This was my first experience with a Springhill Suites. Although I am a Marriott Rewards Gold, I am mostly a Hilton guy (Hilton Honors VIP Diamond for the past three years), I was on a job interview with a major Baltimore company, and they selected the hotel. It really was a pleasant surprise. The room was spacious and clean. I liked having (sort of) two rooms. The furnishings and finish is more like a Courtyard or a Hampton Inn than an Embassy Suites or a Homewood Suite, with which I am more familiar. Service was very friendly and efficient. No recognition of my Marriott Rewards status, but my profile preference for a room on a high floor away from the elevator seems to have been noted -- its what I got. Breakfast was the usual deal with oatmeal, eggs (small cheese omlets), ham, and usual breads, waffles, coffee, juice, etc. No problems there, but nothing exciting. The business center was nice, free and everything worked (computer and printer is what I used). I was just there one night -- in late and out early. I hope to be progressing in the interview process, so maybe I will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is friendly, convenient and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: bayliesky
Reviews.Content: While everyone was nice and did their best to help, Chad in the lounge was amazing. He pays attention to what customers order and when you return knows just what to fix. He was always making sure you had drinks and/or snacks available to make your experience all it could be.... I intentionally asked for his schedule and visited the lounge only when he was working because of the service he provided. Chad is FANTASTIC and deserves to be recognized!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: Dankness
Reviews.Content: Great stays need great feedback. This was a fabulous weekend. The Springhill Suites was perfect for my family and I. We had three rooms, that were all blocked next door to one another. i had noted the need for a crib in one of the suites which was taken care of prior to my check in. This was all appreciated as we came in at separate times late on Friday. The big highlight was the staff. Everyone I interacted with, particulary at the front desk, was friendly and outgoing. There were a couple of specific questions and needs that I required which were all taken care of immediately when I had asked. The location was great in getting down to the inner harbor during the day and places to eat in the evening. The lobby was perfect for my family and I to sit around leisurely after breakfast and in the evenings talking and playing cards. Great lobby space where we felt we could sit and talk all day. Rooms were spacious and clean; I love that the flat screen TV's in the suites hung to the walls, rather than the traditional placement on the dresser. Great hotel, I will stay there again in the future. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Above average (just) for a chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: maineiac
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a king corner suite, which is very spacious. Expected the sleeper sofa to be a double, but it is a single, so had to get a cot for the 4th person in our room. The sleeper sofa and cot were not at all comfortable, but the king sized bed was. As others have pointed out, it is noisy at night. The bathroom situation in this room arrangement is a bit odd - there is a toilet in a room by itself, and a huge room across the hall with a large shower and a sink. It's a crazy huge space for those two fixtures. All spaces (living area with sleeper sofa, toilet area, shower area, and bedroom) can be closed off with pocket doors, which is nice. The room was clean, and housekeeping was quick to fill requests for extra towels and blankets, but there was a used facecloth and towel folded up in the cot when it arrived, which was a little off-putting. Location of hotel is convenient for inner harbor, Camden Yards, and public transport (Baltimore does a great job with this.) Breakfast is typical for a chain hotel - it'll get your day started, but it's nothing special. The lobby is huge, which is nice, as there is plenty of seating for breakfast. Free wifi in the hotel is nice, too. Overall, a decent place for the price - I'd give three and a half circles if that were an option.

Reviews.Title: “Should have read previous reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: Angus29
Reviews.Content: Nice enough hotel, although cleanliness could have been better. The noise from outside the hotel was terrible. Suspect good double glazing would dampen a lot of it. Pepsi delivery at 4 am did little to aid our tormented sleep. A bus load of drunks urinating in the adjacent carpark at 3 am also met with our displeasure. My advise - avoid at all costs if, like us, you like a good nights sleep. Reception staff offhand and mostly unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Less than Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: TCandAna
Reviews.Content: We arrived at BWI Airport and had to wait over 45 minutes for our shuttle pick my wife and I up after calling the hotel. While the room were nice, suggest adding a soap dispenser instead of bar of soap in the bathroom. There's no real place to place the soap after its used and the soap dispenser is a better alternative. Breakfast did not include any type of fruit and the eggs were powdered and didn't taste good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, attentive staff, wonderful value”
Reviews.Author: thehaggs
Reviews.Content: Was tempted to stay at one of the pricier hotels right in the harbor, but decided to save a little money. Well, I didn't have to "settle" for anything. This hotel is just 2 blocks up from the harbor. The beds were so comfy and the rooms were well appointed. The breakfast was a bit disappointing, but was adequate. The vallet service was wonderful, very helpful with directions. What a great weekend

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: flyawaygrl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Spring Hill Suites on a Saturday night this past July with spouse and 3 kids. Really just a nice little hotel. Great first impression due to the courteous staff and cute lobby. The hotel was once a bank and still has the original, ornate vault which has been converted into a conference room. We traveled to Baltimore via Amtrak and therefore didn't have to worry about parking, however, there's a decent sized parking lot adjacent to the hotel. There seemed to be plenty of spots available in the lot. The hotel is just a block from the Inner Harbor and a short walk to Camden Yards. There's also a bus-stop adjacent to the hotel which offers free transit on a "loop" between the Inner Harbor and Penn Station. The staff pointed this out to us when we inquired about a taxi to take us back to the train station. We saved $20.00 that would have otherwise been spent on two cabs! Our room consisted of 2 double beds and a single sofa bed. The room had an odd layout but was well equipped with a fridge, microwave and wet bar. The sitting area had a nice desk and a wall-mounted flat screen TV. The bedroom area, which was separated from the sitting area by a sort of "half" wall also had a wall-mounted flat screen. Obviously both TV's are not meant to be on at the same time! (The kids had fun trying though...can you say HEADACHE!!) The room was very clean and comfortable. There was a nice continental breakfast offered in the lobby. Nothing to write home about but met our needs before a long day of exploring Baltimore's beautiful Inner Harbor. There's also a well-equipped fitness room downstairs near the vault/conference room. The only problem we encountered during our stay was the addition of a $28.00 valet parking charge to our bill. Upon check-out, we showed the front desk clerk the error and it was removed immediately. We'll definitely plan on staying here on our next visit to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jsnyder02
Reviews.Content: I had once stayed before in a SpringHill Suites in a suburban location (VA). This one was much nicer, definitely had more of an in-town classic feel, particularly in the stately lobby. The valet parking (only option at the hotel) is pricey, but I guess that's to be expected. The location is EXCELLENT... just a couple blocks to the Inner Harbor (you can see it when you round the corner upon leaving the hotel), also close to the Mt. Vernon Cultural District. Also close to the Charles Center Metro Station, if you need that. Free breakfast didn't have many options, but for free I suppose you could just be confronted with a continental breakfast, and this was better than that. Overall, a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “within walking distance to Inner Harbor....parking for check in tricky”
Reviews.Author: glebo
Reviews.Content: arrived on a Friday around 6:30 p.m. hard to find a parking spot in order to check in. Valet parking worked well but they need to keep the spaces in front of the hotel available for check in. We walked back and forth to Harbor Square...no problems at all. Breakfast is good - no orange juice, but finally was refilled by an attendant. We heard no noises during the night...seemed to be a very quiet hotel Very unique...used to be a bank - they did a great job making it into a hotel...Hampton Suites next door did the same thing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Pachugita
Reviews.Content: The proximity of this location to the Inner Harbour is great! Only problem is that it is noisy on the weekend. We were there for the 4th of July. There is a night club near by so there was a lot of Police presence. The sirens kept me up. Otherwise the accomodations at the hotel were comfortable and clean. The breakfast was okay if you arrive on time. The staff closes the breakfast section at least fifteen minutes prior to closing, The items are not replenished during that last half hour, so get there early enough. If you want a place close to the Harbour. This is the place. We parked at a local parking facility. Saved a few dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected for Price”
Reviews.Author: sherrietoliver
Reviews.Content: Granted it was the OTAKON convention, I did not get $269 per night worth. Valet was awsome, not enough luggage carts though;called in the evening for extra towels, had to go and get them from front desk; noise all night on Redwood St the first night - at least 2 nightclubs in 1/2 block, couldn't sleep; no maid service after first night, only stayed two nights; two tv's, how can you hear if they are both on,; free internet but slow in room; skip the "market" bring your own or go to 7-11, cvs or subway in one block walking distance. Kitchenette sink, but no dish towel. Beautiful lounge and coffee/tea service. This was my first time here, but may try to go back to the Sheraton on Lafayette St.

Reviews.Title: “Guest Service Representative Yolanda Holden, was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: joannemiye
Reviews.Content: Yolanda Holden, was very helpful & a pleasure to visit with each day. She made sure that we had several places of interest to visit & gave us directions & options for our destinations. Everyone at Spring Hill Suites made our visit enjoyable. Spring Hill Suites hires top notch employees; & is an excellent place to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Wondeful Staff”
Reviews.Author: lesson4u63
Reviews.Content: My father and i stayed here for the weekend of June 4-6 for the Red Sox vs Orioles games.The hotel is located in a great area located close to Camden Yards and Baltimore Harbor.The staff mainly Nick were very helpful and friendly and couldn,t of been more kind! I will stay here whenever i go to Baltimore which i like to do at least once a year.Thanks for your nice stay and your great service!

Reviews.Title: “So-so!”
Reviews.Author: ames1603
Reviews.Content: I went on an overnight business trip and stayed at this hotel. The lobby and breakfast/sitting area have a unique look, not new and fancy, but interesting. I checked in and went to my room. I was given a handicapped room, which was annoying but nice as well. Annoying because I am not handicapped, but nice because the room was more spacious then my colleagues, which I was told were really narrow. The staff very extremely friendly. My bed was squishy and comfortable, but my colleagues complained that theirs weren't at all. They have a decent sized flat-screen tv in the rooms, which was nice... a desk with chair, couch, refridgerator and microwave. The street noise was quite loud at times... lots of truchs passing by on the bumpy road. They offer a continental breakfast, but I had breakfast at a conference that morning, so didn't partake. The location is pretty great... like 2 or 3 blocks from the Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: drc225
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the rate of $149 (exclusive of tax, etc) in late March booked off the Marriott website. The nearby 'discounted' conference hotel rate was $209 + tax so a not insignificant saving. Location is good. a couple of blocks back from the inner harbor. Lots of eating and drinking options in the vicinity. The room was comfortable and clean with a small kitchenette with fridge and microwave but no utensils, plates, etc - not that I'd have used them if hey were there. The free internet worked well. The gym was small with (from memory) a couple of cross trainers, a jogger and bike. Didn't use it. The free breakfast was the standard bagels, etc affair and perfectly adequate. Staff perfectly friendly and helpful in my limited interaction with them. The building itself is quite interesting. Downstairs there is a massive old safe which has been converted into a conference room - yes it's that big. Its worth a look. There is plenty of parking in the vicinity. I found one on Lombard Street (Arrow parking)with a $18 overnight/24 hour rate. others were circa $21.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Noisy Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: nomad633
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel given its good location, just ten minutes away from Fell's Point and its reasonable costs compared to some of the hotels closer to the water. A five minute taxi from the train station. The hotel is clean and the rooms are nice. The only problem is that it is very, very loud at night - sirens, people yelling on the street, and so on. Granted Baltimore is a loud city but do bring earplugs or a noisemaker if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay....”
Reviews.Author: st160
Reviews.Content: I do not normally write reviews, but I was impressed with this hotel. On business trip, the room was more than enough for one person. Would recommend even to bring my family of 4. There was ample room with a king bed, a pull out couch, 2 wall mounted TV's, extra soft chair, desk with WiFi connection. Refrigerator and microwave. Cannot say enough about the pleasant, helpful staff. Great customer service. The location was near the harbor with easy walk to shops and place to eat. I would most definitely recommend this place to any traveler. I thought the free breakfast was ample. No made to order... but more than enough. One night was noisy outside, but never inside. I was even across from the elevator and it was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location -- don't count on the free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: surreyuk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located in the Inner Harbor and a short walk to there and the ball park. The hotel room was very roomy and we had a good amount of space to spread out, even if we just stayed overnight. The only negative was the very poor breakfast that was severely picked over when we got there -- and looked like there was not much to start out with. TIP: vallet parking at the hotel is expensive -- you can drive down the block and park for about $10/per night at one of the garages over the weekend ...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Kansas-Jayhawk
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I recently stayed here on our first trip to Baltimore. The hotel was very clean, quiet, nicely appointed, and walking distance from the sites at the Inner Harbor. Most importantly, the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. They kindly gave us directions every time we needed them (which was every time we left the hotel). They recommended the fantastic Downtown Deli - a tiny little deli with great sandwiches, right across Calvert Street. They held our luggage for us while we toured a bit after our check out. Helpful service with a smile everytime - it was wonderful. There are many, many hotels in this area, even on the same block. I'd go back to the SpringHill suites any time.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, no-frills hotel, great location and nice price”
Reviews.Author: dcpatti
Reviews.Content: We spent New Years Eve at the Spring Hill Suites Inner Harbor and were upgraded to the one-bedroom king suite, due to my Marriott status, which was quite a surprise as my status isn't too high and I rarely get Marriott upgrades. The suite was absolutely massive, with the bedroom being around the size of a normal hotel room, then a nice large living room added in. However, this room had one of the strangest floor plans I have ever seen, with a long hallway separating the two rooms and each half of the bathroom on either side of the hallway. The room where the shower and vanity were, was really large but had some weird rolling doors that we could never get to close all the way, and very large lovely windows which were, unfortunately, very good at sucking all the warm air out of the bathroom. The whole shower-room was just not insulated well, and while the shower itself was oversized and perfectly clean with good pressure, it made for an extremely cold shower. Brrrr! Also it's really annoying to use the bathroom then have to go across the hall to wash your hands. The room where the toilet is could use a little attention, too; while perfectly clean, it's completely undecorated, just a toilet and a door, and feels like the bathroom in a fast food restaurant (well, except it's very clean) The bed was comfortable and the bedding was crisp and clean. The overall furnishings are very generic and not my choice of color schemes; it's kind of a shame because with a little new upholstery, and a few decorating touches, this could be a stellar hotel room. That said, the room was very quiet even though we were steps from the elevator; we couldn't hear any hallway noise at all and that's pretty remarkable on new years eve. Breakfast was a little better than expected for Spring Hill Suites-- your basic pastries and juices plus a very small selection of hot items (bacon, egg patties to make sandwiches with, etc) and appeared to be well-stocked even for new years day when everyone's having breakfast at the same time. Valet parking is $26 which is average for this neighborhood. You can self-park about 2 blocks away and save $6 which wasn't worth it to us when we arrived on a cold rainy night but might have been a better idea when it took about 25 minutes for them to bring our car back the next morning. This is absolutely to be expected at noon (check-out time) on new year's day-- everyone and their brother was trying to get their cars at the same time--- just something for you to factor in as you are making your plans!

Reviews.Title: “great location, charming building”
Reviews.Author: brandinecole
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 nt after completing a ship inspection of the Carnival Pride in August. This hotel was very nice. An older- historic even-building and in a great location. Walkable to Power Plant Live! as well as other stores and the Inner Harbor district. Parking was insane- but I think that is par for the course in that area. The hotel I swear must have been a bank at one point as there is a huge vault in the basement next to the fitness center. They have a small business center and coffee service in the lobby. As an extended stay property the room was very large with nice flatscreen and sofa.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: luckik30
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked into this establishment we were treated like royalty. Upon arriving in Baltimore, I noticed right away what a prime location this hotel has, its about 2 blocks away from the Inner Harbor. The Aquarium, World Trade Center, Maryland Science Center, delicious dining and great shops are only steps away. Plus, the cost is considerably cheaper than other hotels that surround the harbor. We were offered an upgrade (at no additional charge)! I'm not entirely sure why but my boyfriend and myself jumped at the opportunity. Our king size suite was unbelievable. This corner room had a separate seating area and flat screen TV (with computer desk and plenty of windows), shower and vanity with sliding doors (with the toilet across the hall) and open bedrooom (also with flat screen TV, seating area and three large windows). Needless to say, we were more than pleasantly surprised. Everyone at the front desk was polite and courteous all weekend (kudos to the manager, Debra). Even the valets were friendly and offered great service. Surrounded by other hotels and restaurants, you won't have much of a view but that doesn't make or break this establishment. A free, hot breakfast buffet is offered every morning (which we, did not, unfortunately make use of). The only complaint (which you will also find in other reviews about lodging in the harbor) is noise but that cannot be helped by the hotel. All in all, I would definitely return to this Springhill Suites again! ( I am now a Marriott Rewards Member, I liked it so much).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ExitRowAisle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a quick trip. The location was great. Easy to find and easy to get around. Lots of restaurants and shopping 2 blocks away. Rooms were well appointed and clean. Breakfast was good and internet access was free. Had valet parking and the staff was courteous

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, SERVICE, ROOM, LOCATION.”
Reviews.Author: deryckp
Reviews.Content: Was in Baltimore for a convention and brought along the family. Got 2 rooms. the suites were clean, huge, and everything was newly remodeled. breakfast was great too. sometimes a lil too busy. about 2 blocks from inner harbor so walking distance from everything. valet parking was a hassle but no choice in the city. valet attendants were very nice as were the front desk and all hotel emplolyees. would recommend to anyone coming to baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clensing75
Reviews.Content: Not only is the hotel in a really cool building (an old bank building with the vault downstairs still in use as a conference room), but the room was great. The service was great, super fast, very friendly, and informative. The room was ideal for a couple with a child. We had enough privacy to be able to watch TV after kids went to bed. NICE!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, free breakfast, free wi-fi.”
Reviews.Author: malaplan
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here due to its proximity to the Inner Harbor and Camden Yards. The price was reasonable compared to others in the area, although please note that parking was valet only and ran $28 per night. The area was safe and well lit, and surprisingly quiet despite being downtown, with a few sirens from time to time. The staff were exceptionally friendly and welcoming. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and there were two flat screen TVs present. There was a pretty decent complimentary breakfast with waffles, scrambled eggs, Canadian bacon, cereal etc.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel staff ever”
Reviews.Author: cmwither
Reviews.Content: I won't go into details about the room, because a few have already described it, but we were pleased. It was clean and comfortable. The staff was extremely friendly-recommending restaurants and even calling to ask questions about the menus, without us asking them to. They arranged a shuttle to get us to the restaurant we ended up picking, but everything is so close and convienient, we walked back. We were on the 9th floor, so the only street noise we got were a few sirens. We did hear some noise in the hallway as our room was directly across from the elevator, but nothing worth complaining about. The breakfast buffet was a nice touch, nothing special, and the line was long, but hey- it's free. All in all, a great trip at a great hotel with a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: budmancubfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed the first night of our trip here to accomodate our grandchildren. I'm not sure why the street noise can be heard so well, but it is really bad. Our room was across the street from a nightclub and the noise was till 3 or 4 in the morning. Would not stay there again because of that.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely staying here again!!!”
Reviews.Author: paws4jas
Reviews.Content: This hotel completely exceeded my expectations. It's lovely, has a nice staff and fabulous location. Only 2 blocks to the Inner Harbor, and a short walk to Camden Yards. Very nice free breakfast buffet as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GreerGirl
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a great hotel to combine business with fun in Baltimore, this is it! The Springhill has wireless & wired internet plus a great business center, huge guest suites with sitting & work areas, plus it's all found in a fantastic historic building close to everything in the inner harbor. The building is a former bank, so be sure to check out the vault that's now a meeting room downstairs. We had a great meeting there, and when we were done with business, we were able to walk a couple blocks to great restaurants & shopping. Really fun location, and the staff took great care of us.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Julie-14222
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three weeks at the Spring Hill Suites. The room was very clean and well designed. The staff consistently went out of their way to provide information and assistance. I would rate this property as 4 stars and would would very highly recommend to anyone visiting Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: YankeeinFL
Reviews.Content: Was in Baltimore with my family and some friends for the Notre Dame-Navy football game in mid November at nearby Ravens Stadium. The hotel, located in a former bank building, is small but clean. If you have younger children, show them the former vault (now a meeting room) in the basement. The complementary breakfast was more than adequate. The hotel's location is good, not great. (It is a bit of a walk to the nearest Light Rail stop but we made the walk twice). The walk to the Inner Harbor area is easy. The hotel staff was pleasant and helpful when asked a question.

Reviews.Title: “Not Much to Add to What Others Have Said”
Reviews.Author: Foghorn8508
Reviews.Content: Not much to add to what others have said. Stayed in room 709. HGad two double beds. Clean, stafff was very nice. The housekeeper heard us talking about all the emergency squads and all the noise they make and reached into her cart and gave us ear plugs. We never used them, but what do you expect when you are in the heart of the city with two emergency rooms less than a 1/2 mile away. Close to the inner harbor to the south. I would not advise going too far more to the north, looks like the neighborhood gets a bit rougher. The hotel is in a great old bank building that has been refurbished. You have to go down stairs and see the old vault! Just wish that the breakfast selection would have changed over the 5 days I stayed. Always the same round sausage and round processed eggs, biscuts and gravy and make your own waffles, along with the other usual cereals, muffins and yogurt selections. A change in the hot selection swould have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, not PERFECT, but close”
Reviews.Author: dragonOL2
Reviews.Content: To give 5 "dots" or whatever they are, I think perfection is key. Springhill Suites was a great place to stay, but not without some faults. First of all, make sure you can make your way around Baltimore and around the Inner Harbor area (or just familiarize yourself while you are there). The directions placed the hotel on a main one-way street and it was actually on a cross street intersecting the main one, which was a little confusing. Valet parking is near-required to stay here unless you want to park your car a few blocks away and haul your own luggage to the place (not recommended)! You will pay a price though; $28 a night for the service. Check in was very easy and we were greeted warmly by the staff. Our room was SUPER comfortable and pleasant. My g/f was very pleased and she can be hard to please at times so that should tell you something. 2 x flat screen TVs in the room (king suite), a microwave, a fridge, and all the other little things you'd expect were present. FREE WIRELESS INTERNET!!! Also included broadband "wired" internet if you don't have wireless capabilities. I will have to say that at night things were a tad bit noisy. I'm a pretty heavy sleeper at times so I wasn't bothered but the misses is an extra light sleeper. The hotel is right in the heart of downtown and sirens at night, yelling on the street, and some construction could be heard, even though we were 6 floors up. So for this reason (also, no view of anything but other buildings surrounding the immediate area, which was a bit disappointing) as well as the enormous valet parking price are what will make me take this one down a notch. All-in-all, I was extremely satisfied with the comfortable stay, the great location (despite the noise, we were walking distance to all the great downtown restaurants and tourist attractions), and the great service for a great price. Definitely recommended for a stay in downtown Baltimore!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TJ3370
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Baltimore for the AST Dew Action Sports Tour. The hotel was beautiful. The room we stayed in had 2 flat screened TVs, plenty of room and it was very clean. We traveled with a teenage son, and he enjoyed the complementary breakfast, which says a lot considering how much he can eat! The property is located within walking distance to the Inner Harbor and Camden Yards. However, a cab ride to Camden Yards is only $5, which we found out after a long day at the event. I highly recommend this hotel and I can be quite particular about where we stay.

Reviews.Title: “Genteel”
Reviews.Author: willtravel12345
Reviews.Content: An old converted bank building just up the street from the Inner Harbor. Easy to get to driving, valet parking makes unloading and checking in a breeze. Very personable staff. Attractive rooms. Going for flat screen TV's on walls made living room TV watching layout a little awkward, but a nice suite. A/C wasn't working real well, but we didn't know this until after we returned from dinner and then the hotel wasn't able to get it checked before bedtime. They volunteered to discount the room. So while we had to open the windows which didn't work all that well overnight and listen to Baltimore sirens, it was OK. Would recommend a lower rather than higher floor. Nothing to see higher except pigeons and abandoned buildings. Good complimentary breakfast. Very convenient to Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: RedPatch
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Marriott’s SpringHill Suites during a business trip and was very pleased. The hotel was originally a bank. The old vault is still intact and is quite beautiful. It is located in the basement, along with the laundry and exercise rooms, a must see if you visit. Each morning Marriott's breakfast was available for guests. My room was clean, newly remodeled, spacious and beautiful. The bed was one of the most comfortable I’ve slept on during a business trip! Flat screen televisions were located in both the sleeping and sitting/work areas. Internet access was free and easily accessible. The hotel was within walking distance to both the Inner Harbor shopping/tourist area and convention center. I had read some complaints about the noise from this particular hotel. It is nothing more than what you would expect to hear while staying in a large city…sirens, etc. I can honestly say that I found this hotel to be one of the nicer ones I have stayed at while on business in the Baltimore area. The front desk staff was exceedingly friendly as was the bartender who was always there to help with directions and helpful dining tips. The cleaning staff did a fabulous job. In my opinion you can’t go wrong staying here!

Reviews.Title: “would try somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: leah888
Reviews.Content: This hotel advertises a king sized bed and sofa bed. The sofa bed is a twin size and not made up with linens. We checked into the hotel with our two children @ 10 PM. When I called the front desk to ask why there were no linens on the bed, they responded by asking me, "well, why on earth would we put linens on the bed if the bed is going to be folded up?" We also needed a rollaway for our second child, since the sofa bed is a twin size. The first sofa bed wreaked of body odor. The second was brand new and fine. The location of the hotel is very good. Breakfast was adequate. The room itself was clean. Wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable buisiness stay ever”
Reviews.Author: williamsnursery
Reviews.Content: I generally travel to the inner harbor on business twice a year. Generally I would stay at the Sheraton (formerly the Wyndham) since that the property that was close to the convention center but fit into the budget. I've never been impressed by them at all, and the last time I stayed there I said never again. Seeing that the hotel was only an extra block away, I decided to stay here at the SpringHill Suites. I was extremely impressed. The room may have been a tad small, but there was a small comfortable living room complete with a microwave, sink coffee pot, fridge and a plasma tv. The bedroom had an extremely comfortable bed also with a plasma tv. This is a newly opened property and I did like the room, but what impressed me even more was how friendly and helpful the staff of this hotel was during my entire visit. I travel out of town about fifty days a year this is the first time that I was so totally impressed that I decided that the staff needed a pat on the back and a job well done from me, and I'm hoping that in writing this review they get that pat on the back. Every staff member that I came in contact with greeted me with a smile and a hello. I felt like I was staying at a friends house, not a corporate property and I will definitely stay here next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Hotel, Clean Friendly Staff and Exceptional Rooms”
Reviews.Author: TheNCGeechieGal
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the hotel last week (Jan 2008) travelling on business. I had originally booked at the Hampton Inn, which was across the street; however, I didn't realize the SHS was THAT close to our office so I called the hotel literally from my rental car and made the change. The staff was very friendly and amenable to all of my requests and I was pleasantly surprised at the amenities and condition of the hotel. The front desk told me that it just opened in Nov 2007 so there's still a lot of 'newness' everywhere. Keeping in mind that this is a SHS (category 4) so it's laid back with less frills though NOT less class. My room was PERFECT. It was a one bedroom suite, which was quite large from most. The livingroom was very spacious with a large screen, flat panel TV, sofa, chair and workstation. The wireless worked without any problems, though there was also an ethernet cable available. The cabinets were darkwood, with dishes, microwave and mini-fridge. I had a walk down the hallway to a HUGE bath that was completely separate from the toilet (toilet was across the hall from the shower). The stand-up shower was very large with two large frosted windows. The vanity easily held all MY stuff (which is saying A LOT!) Further down the hall was the bedroom with one smaller dresser and two nightstands; another large flatscreen panel TV with beautiful pix, unusually high # of cable channels, PLUS the radio has an iPod jack/stem. The bed was very comfortable with lots of fluffy pillows and extra blankets in the closet. Given the class of this hotel, there's no room service but the front desk is happy to give you menus to restaurants that DON'T charge a delivery charge, though some have minimum orders like $25. I ordered two nites from Mo's and it was pretty good. A colleague ordered pizza from another delivery place and found it to be pretty good as well. You're also in the heart of things so you can walk to nice restaurants in the area. The hotel does provide breakfast with a very large variety of options, from self-poured waffles to muffins, bagels, fruit and juices/coffee. There was noise outside but you can't blame a hotel for street noises in a large city like Baltimore. The rooms are pretty well insulated so I didn't hear anymore noise than I do in Toronto...NYC...DC...etc. I had NO complaints with this hotel. HIGHLY recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Bring Ear Plugs”
Reviews.Author: thebeez
Reviews.Content: From 12:30 AM to 3:30 AM, there was a disturbance outside from patrons of a nearby nightclub so loud it woke everyone in my room up. I'm usually a heavy sleeper -- it takes a lot to wake me up. When I called the front desk around 2:00 AM to ask them to do something about the noise, they said this was a usual occurrence on weekend nights and they would have to call the police to get the crowd to go home. The noise outside is out of the hotel's control, but if this was a usual occurrence, I would expect the hotel staff to PROACTIVELY call the police instead of waiting for their guests to complain. The next morning, we decided to check out early. The person at the front desk commented that we were checking out early, but didn't bother to ask WHY, and looked like she could care less. At over $200 per night, I expect a hotel to offer good service to their guests. This one failed miserably.

HotelInfo.Name: SpringHill Suites by Marriott Baltimore Inner Harbor
HotelInfo.Address: 120 East Redwood Street, Baltimore, MD 21202
